content.description:
Tu quoque litoribus nostris, AeneiaAeneius, -a, -um, adj.: of Aeneas nutrixnutrix, -icis, f.: nurse, 
aeternam moriens famam, CaietaCaieta, -ae, f.: Caieta (a female, Trojan name), dedisti.
content.question: In the passage, which of the following describes the grammatical function of the participle moriens?

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 1.B: Describe how grammar contributes to the meaning and function of Latin words and phrases in context.
